Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs everywhere”
Reviews.Author: Lisa J
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Dubai at the Gulf pearl. On arrival we found the hotel dirty and unwelcoming but decided to give it a go. After the first night my daughter woke up all bitten and with rashes all over her body. We took her to hospital and they informed us that this was bedbugs bites and she was allergic to them. She had to be taken to hospital for treatment . The hotel is not a safe place and should be avoid at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good for disco lovers”
Reviews.Author: Hatim75
Reviews.Content: The hotel on the whole is pretty good, but i did not enjoy my stay here as there are aroung 4 to 5 night clubs inside the hotel. The music is going on throughout the night which was quite disturbing to me. I guess for people who like to go clubs would love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had read the comments before going there”
Reviews.Author: resius92
Reviews.Content: First of all I must defend myself and say I'm not that careless to choose a mid range hotel before checking others comment but I was in a such hurry this time that I had no choice but accept the agency suggestion. everyhing that should be mentioned is already said by other victims and I just want to write my conversation with staff; in second night I saw three coakroaches on the floor, I just went down and told the guy in reservation that my room is full of cockroaches! I just took photo of three of them, he said then there is just FEW of them not many as you say! can you believe it??? I myself am Iranian but I think the main problem is because of iranian passengers who don't care about such problems, they don't expect much from the hotel to be clean rooms or good food, although they have paid enough for a much better hotel (like Moscow hotel for example) and I think it's because they're mostly from small cities in Iran or they wouldn't stay in that hotel for a night. I had this chance to goto my cousin's home although I didn't want to disturb her, but other know that I had no other chance! JUST STAY AWAY! DON'T EVEN THINK ABOUT IT! YOU CAN SLEEP MUCH BETTER IN STREETS AND YOU CAN SAVE MORE MONEY TOO!

Reviews.Title: “"NEVER EVER" GO TO THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: abbey-scotland
Reviews.Content: Hi All, I and my family (wife and 2 teenage daughters) were in this hotel from the 12th to 16th January 2009, we had booked 2 rooms, 12th Jan 2009- We got to the hotel around 3pm very tiered after our flight was delayed for 4 hrs. We got our rooms on the 2nd floor next to each other they were clean until we went into the bathrooms, they were filthy both of them. The cleaning staff were in the hall way I called them in to clean them and they did the best they could but the bath tubs had cracks in them with solid dirt in them, while they were doing that the kids were in the balcony’s and when they came back in the rooms they doors wouldn’t lock again, I called the maintenance staff up to have a look at it, all he said was I am sorry I cant fix it, but don’t worry the girls will be fine in room. NO WAY was I going to let my girls sleep in a room that had the doors unlocked. I then went down to the reception to get the rooms changed, they said no problem at all by now it’s around 6pm we have not even had time to eat yet. We got moved to other rooms to be honest they were not much better the only good thing was they both had 2 queen size beds in each room, but we just wanted rest and have something to eat. We were told the staff will being our luggage to the new rooms in around 10 mins but we waited for 1hr called the reception they said they will send someone up, another half again no one came I just went and got the 4 suitcases and 3 bags myself. The girls ended up sleeping in our room. What a waste of night that was. 13th Jan 2009- The breakfast was quit good we left the hotel around 11am, I left the notice on the door saying “service the room” we got back at around 6pm to get changed to go out for a meal and surprise surprise the room was just as we left it, again I called the cleaning staff and they said they will be up shortly. We left and came back in at 11pm, the girls went to there room 20 mins later they came screaming back to our room. Saying there were COCKROCHES in the bathroom I went to have look and there were 4 under the sink and back of the toilet, Furious I went to the reception and talked to the night manager, he said we will move you to other rooms AGAIN …… so we were now moved to the 3rd floor, the rooms were a little larger, the girls were so frightened they again slept in out room. 14th Jan 2009- Again the breakfast had a nice selection, they rooms were cleaned while we were out over all the day was actually good. 15th Jan 2009- Had breakfast and went out enjoying our last day in Dubai until we got back to the hotel at night around 9pm we had a flight at 8am back home. We went to check the girls room for cockroaches and there they were in the bathroom again by this time the girls were terrified even to sleep in out room, my wife calmed them down and went to our room, I went down to inform the manger again, to be honest I lost my temp with him he cam up and had a look for himself apologised and said he will call our booking agents Asia travel for a full refund for 1 room to be arranged I got a letter confirming that. I was shocked when I went back to my own room there were COCKROCHES there too, to be honest even the manager was shocked he offered us another room change but we didt want to move again it was our last night, there was one in the bed and several around the room, this time I took photos I have uploaded them here. We were so glad to leave the hotel at 5am. We didt sleep at all that night. Still waiting for my refund.......... PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS.

Reviews.Title: “How can there be 100+ hotels in Dubai worse than this ?”
Reviews.Author: Gulfmark
Reviews.Content: My Office booked this place on the basis of price and keeping a lid on costs. I read the reviews with mixed feelings and hoped for the best thinking that you get what you pay for and also that it wasn't bottom of the pile here on TA. It took an eternity to find it - not the hotels fault I grant you but some better directions would be in order. Nowhere to park other than pay meter parking at 20AED. Who has 20 x 1 AED coins with them I ask... ( put my Visa card into one of those street meters - you are kidding me) I abandoned the car and left my suitcase in it. Figured I'd sort out any difficulty later. The hotel wasn't good. In fact it was awful. My low expectations were not even close to imagining how poor it was. The decor was a cross between a down market curry house in a depressed northern British city and a brothel. Hideous brown paintwork competed with appalling shades of vinyl seat covers... The room I was allocated was filthy and had not been serviced. God knows what stains were on the bed but I rather suspected somebody had been murdered or deflowered on there the previous night... On complaining the service team came to check and at first seemed to think I was being awkward before agreeing that perhaps it needed cleaning ...perhaps...????......They gave me another room that had been 'serviced' but that was grubby as well. Iron burns on the carpet, no curtains to speak of, no tea or coffee making facility , just not clean and not fresh in any way. It also seemed way to close to the night clubs I had seen on the way in. I sat on the bed having carefully checked it for body spills. I weighed up my options and decided that I didn't like it and I especially didn't like the idea of 8 days of it. I went to reception and had a stand up row to get my passport back - they claimed I had already got it back- and I left to find somewhere else. Do yourself a favour and don't go here. If you are used to UK Travelodge or better you will hate it. If you are looking for ghastly, cheap, don't mind other people's dirt and like the idea of a truly downbeat surly location you'll love it, and you will most likely be from the Indian subcontinent.

Reviews.Title: “budet option”
Reviews.Author: janetta45
Reviews.Content: stayed here as the bigger beach hotels are double+ in price-read the reviews before i went.Yes the heavy blankets looked like they needed a wash.Breakfast not too bad -pool was open but not heated. Goodcentral location for sight seeing-on the whole staff not very helpful in giving info about area. THE very worst thing was the IRANIAN disco -thought things were going well untill i was woken when the music started at 11pm until 3am each morning-thought i was having a nightmare-after 3 nights i could take no more and asked to be moved-I believe there are 3 discos in this hotel-2 were closed for refit!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at ALL costs”
Reviews.Author: AbuDhabiLocals
Reviews.Content: All the bad reviews on this place were correct and then some. The hot water didn't work, the nightclub kept everyone awake until 3AM. The toilet was leaking, no baby cot was supplied when requested, fridge was not working, linen was ripped and dirty, hand basin was blocked. Requested 2 x single beds and got one double so 2 people had to share the one bed. Parking was miles away, no security and the car was damaged during the overnight stay (someone ran a key down the side of the doors!!!!). The location map was nowhere near correct and it took us hours to find the place. We only stayed that one night through necessity and then complained the next day and management seemed unwillingly or uncaring enough to do anything so we cancelled and went back to the booking agent and got a full refund even for the night we stayed. We live in the UAE so know what to expect from 3 stars but this place would be closed down anywhere else in the world. Avoid at ALL costs save yourself the pain and pay a little more !!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous Gulf Hell hotel”
Reviews.Author: nightowl41
Reviews.Content: booked direct to stay 3 nights- sounded really good value. On first impressions on arrival we were horrified by the filthy area outside, the whole place was in need of a good clean ,the hotel looked Tacky , faded and the 'juke-box' facade cheap and nasty. We were unable to park in the slip road and offload luggage, no attempt of assistance from outside staff- they waved us away, refusing to move barriers in the kerb,eventually on the 3rd attempt after 15mins of driving round the block,our taxi driver had to park on the pavement to allow us to get out , we left our luggage in the boot, hoping that the driver would not drive off. On entering we were appalled by the smell and filthy carpet in the tiny foyer, so requested to see the room first- we had booked a twin room with balcony. The lift was also very dirty, the carpet along the dingy dark corridor was badly stained, greasy and patched with strips of brown tape, wrinkled and badly fitted, the room was absolutely disgusting - Uninviting Double bed -dark and gloomy decor, dilapidated dirty dated furniture, ragged curtains & filthy stained nets at the dirty window (there was no balcony-) overlooking a yard piled high with old furniture,scaffold poles,wood and rubbish!. certainly not a room with a view!-a very oppressive atmosphere - on inspecting the bathroom,the floor was grimy and toilet none too clean- pulled back the shower curtain to find dirty,mouldy tiles and bath in need of good clean as well!!!! the room stank of stale perspiration and food. We would not have stayed even if paid to do so, it was appalling. We couldn't get out quick enough and refused to check in, saying we would be reporting them to Dubai Tourism for gross misrepresentation, they should be removed from their web site. It should be demolished. Fortunately our driver waited, we were able to make a phone call to a relation living in Dubai,and booked into another hotel Ramee Apts in Al Rolla Rd- they were excellent.! Dawn & Mike Walsh from London.uk.

Reviews.Title: “Its perfect if your on a buget”
Reviews.Author: monkeyjmcmanus
Reviews.Content: I arrived to Dubai having read the reviews on the hotel and i really didn't know what to exspect. Yes there are the night clubs that are stated how ever i never heard them once. i had really good nights sleep. The rooms have every thing you need from a fridge, bed, A/C, bathroom, clean towels, hairdryer and TV. If you are on a buget these rooms are ideal. I have no complaints. The staff in the hotel are all very friendly and very helpful. One thing don't buy soft drinks in the hotel they are more than double the price than they are in the local shop which is about 100m away. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want cheap, its not 5 star but its perfect for just getting some sleep. Even the pool was really peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “not gulf Pearl but Gulf Hell”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKnight
Reviews.Content: We were told its a 3 star hotel when we booked infact its a 2 star, we booked a room for 3 people on the top floor we were given a room on the first floor with 2 mattresses sitting on top of each other for the 3rd bed. The noise that came from the club underneath was tremendous till 3:00am every morning. The following day we were moved again to have 2 beds again and a mattress on the floor for the 3rd person and no bed linnen and toilet paper. The third night we were moved again to the top floor as requested with 3 beds but no toilet pan. I cannot understand how such hotels can operate, I would not recommended it to anyone. The location is hopeless, the brekfast is terribile and to have anything else done for eg your laundry you pay top money. Overall I would say this is the worst hotel I have ever experienced in my life and would not recommended it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Effie01
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here during a stopover between London and Bangkok. The staff were friendly when checking in and leaving, the room was adequate, a bit drab but we weren’t expecting much. They had sprayed far too much air freshener to disguise the smell of stale smoke. One can walk to the gold souk from here and it is not far from the airport but it is necessary to get a taxi to the more modern parts of Dubai. The reason for the low rating was the three nightclubs that occupy the basement and that go on till 3 in the morning. We were on the third floor and it was still unbelievably loud making it very difficult to get to sleep. Certainly not a place to get a refreshing nights sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel we have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: oshea
Reviews.Content: to whom it may concern, from a family in ireland, about the worst hotel we ever stayed at. === On arrival after our long journey from ireland, we stepped into dubai airport, it was beautiful, even though we were tired and jet lagged, it was our first visit to dubai, so not knowing what to do we went to information, to see how to get to our hotel, either by bus or taxi, taxi was recommended, so of we went, after about 20 min we arrived in a part of dubai called deira, it was near the famous gold markets,when we stepped into the foyer we looked at each other, and my heart sank, it was dull and scruffy looking, we filled in some forms and were taken to the lift with our baggage, by the bell boy i would say he was helpful, the lifts were smelly, and scruffy, finally our rooms on 4th floor no 406 and 409, when i opened the door and seen my room i knew i had made a bad mistake,the carpets were disgusting and dirty, so bad you needed to have something on your feet , the tiles were mouldy in the bathroom and you wondered to yourself was it safe to sit on the toilet seat.. the bases of the beds were also very dirty looking, we had booked a double room for ourselfs, and a twin room for our daughters. double room was 2 single beds pushed together, so when you lay in the centre you nearly fell on the floor between the 2 beds. they had given us some sort of heavy blankets, that you were afraid to touch, my wife took at least 1hour before she could get her breath, with the smell in the room, lights were not working on the walls, by now we were really tired, so sleep was getting the better of us, my wife asked me to close the so called curtains on the veranda, but when i went to do this , i noticed that the lace curtains were missing as well as the runners, all that was there was 2 heavy curtains that were fixed either side of the window, i knew if i went to move these the whole frame holding them would probly break., so we had to sleep first night with no privacy. and people across the road could see clearly into the room. when i lay down i found myself getting very itchy, as if the bed was alive with fleas, this also happened with my wife. after getting up a few times , with scratching myself, we finally fell asleep,, next morning my wife showed me little lumps or bites on her back, i went to front desk and told them about curtains and no wall lights, maintainence man arrrived about 20 mins later, told us he would sort out the curtains, so he used the 2 heavy curtains, and pulled them closed in the middle and joined them with a large pin, this was ok, i thought, this would only be for a short time, but was still like this on the morning of our departure. so we had no veranda or sun during the day. i asked at reception were the pool was located , they told me it was under renovation, so i went for a look, on the top floor, there was a pool ok, with no water, looked like it had not been in use for a few years, actually there were black rubbish bags thrown into the base of the pool, it was totally disgraceful. nothing was matching the photos and the information we had seen on the internet. when we booked this DUMP. the breakfast was very poor, we tried to contact the company we had made the reservation with ,,,, they asked me for my ref no, but the paper with this was locked away with our passports, so it was a waste of time trying to explain, i will be reporting this to the u.a.e tourism board, i know if someone owned a hotel like that , over in ireland, the health people would close it down, thia was meant to be a special holiday as my oldest girl is getting marrried next feb07. so this was our last family holiday . and what a dissapointing one it turned out to be alll because of the hotel we had booked, i have contacted the travel company we booked this through, to see what they have to say, after alll ,,, they are given false information. i left the best bit to last, on thurs we went out around the souks, for a walk, came back to hoel around 11.30 pm, room next to ours had a massage sign over the door, i said to my wife i never noticed this before, and us only next door, next thing some girs, chinese ithink, came to the door and asked my wife and myself if we wanted massage, we both replied no thank you, as we had to pack our cases, as we were leaving for the airport 4 am, well let me put it another way, it was the first time that so many people visited that one room, the 5 days we stayed there/ it was disgusting with my wife and myself one side and my 2 daughters the other side of this room. i will never use this company again, i would safely say it would be better to sleep in one of the parks or even on the street. watch this space later when i will attach photos of this dump, they called it 3 stars, i rate it less than 1 star. never stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Place”
Reviews.Author: sutty331
Reviews.Content: Stayed here nov 26th -30th 2006. It was a last minute booking made with a company called Asia travel who rated the hotel 3 star..What a joke...the place was abysmal, dirty and downright 1 star if lucky. The location was at the far end of Deira, about ten minutes walk to the nearest bus stop at the gold souk. Every shop within half a mile seemed to be a Mobile phone shop. The rooms were dark and decrepid and smelt of smoke and feist. Our beds were made but contained only one sheet that you slept on which meant you had to be covered by the bedstaed which obviously had not been washed since the turn of the century. At night the hotel was even worse. The noise coming from the 3 nightclubs kept you awake till after 3am. I complained to the reception and they promised to move us the next day. We were moved and the noise was less but the room was just as bad/dirty. Break fast was atrocious. the only thing remotely edible was the pasta and that was horrid. We only went to breakfast once and then i only tried a bit of the pasta and an orange juice My advice to anyone travelling to dubai, even if only for a short stay is to spend the extra money and go to jumeriah which was far better...please stay away from the gulf pearl...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Gulf Pearl - Enjoy Dubai.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gulf Pearl, a true picture and a face of rupturing Dubai tourism. Par excellent service and classy rooms depicting the true colors of arabian culture. We came totally unplanned and unknown of Dubai but the hotel staff just made it easier for us, that we eneded up with one of the best vacations. The rooms are fairly bigger than an average thre star and the room service is prompt and very courtageous. The Front office had us waken up with transport for the day, desert safari , exotic food and romantic river cruise. They even had a beach and the famous City Center mall transfer free of cost. My kids enjoyed the s/pool with a top view of the Corniche and we spend our nights dancing in the Iranian Night Club with the famous singer Hoji John band. Overall, we had great fun with Hotel Gulf Pearl and we would definitly suggest to all readers and we wil try ourselves to visit them again.

Reviews.Title: “Saty away from the Gulf Peril!”
Reviews.Author: LouciferLondonUK
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this hotel! This hotel was so very cheap, I wasn't expecting anything, but I still found myself complaining twice a day with reception about a problem. It all started early; the bell boy broke a bottle of duty free vodka on the way to our room; reception said sorry, and only after I asked them if they were going to replace it or refund it, they looked very surprised at the request, called the bell boy and reproached him and humiliated him in front of me. There was a safe in the room and we were really happily surprised about it, because we had lots of cash, but it didn't work. We asked if it could be made to work, and they assured us that it would be done. They could have just said: 'look this is a three star hotel and our safes are old, why don't we look after your valuables at reception?' Instead they kept smiling and assuring us everything would be fixed and changed our room twice, for increasingly worse rooms! The rooms were pretty basic. There were greasy fingermarks on the wadrobe, and there was mildew in every single bathroom of the 4 I saw, the toilet seat in our first room was broken, and the lightbulb in the bathroom was gone, and despite our repeated requests, never replaced.The carpet hadn't been hoovered, it smelled and made a worrying noise when you walked on it, as it it had been laid on an older, disintegrating floor covering. I followed the procedure of corteously alerting reception as soon as a problem presented itself, to give them the opportunity to sort it out, but the incompetence and indolence of the staff was staggering. It was obviously a well practiced strategy, because in the end I had complaining fatigue and asked for nothing, and when my magazines ( Mac User and Man's Health total cost £11.80 still mostly unread) disappeared from the room, I just could not be bothered to tell them!
